definition: one side/other/different/lateral component of a Chinese character (such as 刂[dao1], 亻[ren2] etc)
suffix of a noun of locality
erhua variant of 旁邊|旁边[pang2 bian1]

sentences.english: Or onto the person next to you?

sentences.chinese: 旁边躺著的就是你的爱人。

sentences.english: What vitamin or what is that split to lack on the side of fingernail?
sentences.chinese: 手指甲旁边那块裂开了是缺少什么维生素还是什么啊？

sentences.english: Cyndie crouches beside him on the sidewalk.
sentences.chinese: Cyndie蹲在他旁边的人行道上。

sentences.english: “What's in the yellow door next to the green stairwell?” Julia asked.
sentences.chinese: “楼梯间旁边的黄门里有什么？”茱莉亚问。

sentences.english: I drove home with the dog on the front seat beside me.
sentences.chinese: 我开车带小狗回家，它就坐在我旁边的位置上。

sentences.english: Students eat huddled around makeshift coal burners for warmth.
sentences.chinese: 学生们围在煤炉旁边吃饭边取暖。

sentences.english: Foot of the mountain there is a clear bottoming out of the creek, streams next to the terraces.
sentences.chinese: 山脚下有一条清澈见底的小溪，小溪旁边是梯田。

sentences.english: Then they carried the ark into Dagon's temple and set it beside Dagon.
sentences.chinese: 非利士人将神的约柜抬进大衮庙，放在大衮的旁边。

sentences.english: I walked carefully down to the front and sat beside them.
sentences.chinese: 我小必翼翼地走到前面坐在了他们的旁边。

sentences.english: Click the forward button, located by the start button.
sentences.chinese: 单击位于开始按钮旁边的前进按钮。

sentences.english: Beside it, half buried in dirt, was a discarded banner.
sentences.chinese: 在它旁边，一条丢弃的横幅半埋于污泥中。

sentences.english: The system is controlled from a board fixed next to the chute door.
sentences.chinese: 该系统由垃圾道门口旁边的一个面板来控制。

sentences.english: I was standing next to the forsythia is still looking at.
sentences.chinese: 我站在旁边仍然在望着连翘。

sentences.english: The john by the morning market is always dirty.
sentences.chinese: 早市旁边的厕所总是不干净。

sentences.english: The metal stand next to the desk is a local flea market find.
sentences.chinese: 桌子旁边的金属架子是在本地的跳蚤市场买的。

definition: one side/other/different/lateral component of a Chinese character (such as 刂[dao1], 亻[ren2] etc)
(sitting) opposite/across (the street)/directly in front/to be face to face
